#summary What do I need to use sprout.

There are 3 things your hosting has to provide for you to be able to use sprout:

 1. Java (1.4 or 1.5)
 2. MySQL (any version)
 3. Apache (preferrably 2)

The only tricky part is that you need to [http://code.google.com/p/rupy/wiki/VirtualHostProxy VirtualHostProxy] your domain in Apache, simply ask if your hoster can enter the followin config into the apache:
{{{
NameVirtualHost *:80
VirtualHost *:80>
ServerName yourdomain.com
ServerAlias www.yourdomain.com
ProxyPass / http://localhost:9000/
ProxyPassReverse / http://localhost:9000/
</VirtualHost>
}}}
